title: Best AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT GPUs in 2024
text: Looking for the very best RX 7900 XT? We've got you covered! Buying the best graphics card allows you to enjoy your favorite PC games as the developers intended. The card is capable of running games at resolutions up to 4K, so long as you don't mind turning down a setting or two to achieve the most stable frame rates. In terms of competition, you could compare the RX 7900 XT against the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4080. Availability for this GPU appears limited, so here's a collection of my favorite RX 7900 XT GPUs. One of my favorite RX 7900 XT cards PowerColor's Radeon RX 7900 XT is a powerful graphics card capable of handling 4K gaming. The 20GB of VRAM is plenty enough for storing as much game data as possible, allowing the system to run smoothly. The tri-fan setup is also great at keeping the card within optimal operating temperatures. The PowerColor Hellhound Radeon RX 7900 XT is an enticing proposition for building a powerful gaming PC. Designed for 1440p and 4K gaming, this graphics card has a tri-fan setup for keeping the AMD GPU cool under load. The beefy shroud does require confirmation with the case GPU support to check if it'll fit inside smaller cases, but this also ensures you'll have no problems with temperatures in-game. It also looks good with a stealthy design and RGB lighting on the three fans. 20 GB of GDDR6 VRAM is available, which is more than enough for stable 2K gaming. The card should also be able to store plenty of 4K textures before running out of space. The usual 5,376 steam processors are present for handling all the rendering, taking advantage of AMD's available ray tracing and AI cores. Two modes are present on PowerColor's Radeon RX 7900 XT, allowing you to switch between an OC or silent profile. The former will set maximum game and boost clock speeds to 2,130 MHz and 2,500 MHz, respectively. Another fine aftermarket RX 7900 XT The Sapphire Pulse Radeon RX 7900 XT is a cracking GPU with ample performance for 1440p and 4K gaming. It's a solid choice for those with a hefty budget and reasonable requirements. Sapphire's Pulse Radeon RX 7900 XT is very much a reference card with no RGB lighting and a stealthy design. If you're building a PC without a side glass panel or have no desire for RGB lighting, this Sapphire GPU would be a good pick. Powering this GPU is the same RDNA 3 architecture as other RX 7900 XT cards. 20 GB of GDDR6 VRAM is present for storing game data for quicker processing and should allow for high frame rates at 1440p and 4K with a few settings turned down. The GPU has a game clock speed of 2,075 MHz with the ability to boost up to 2,450 MHz when pushed hard. With three fans available, the card can maintain comfortable temperatures under load, so long as case cooling is adequate — we've compiled a list of the best PC case fans if you need some. XFX makes some solid GPUs and this is no exception The XFX Speedster MERC310 RX 7900 XT is a powerful 1440p and 4K graphics card. It offers the best of what AMD has with this generation of RDNA computing, resulting in a powerful GPU for high-fidelity gaming. XFX has made some excellent graphics cards for years and the company's Speedster MERC310 RX 7900 XT Black is a great choice for 1440p and 4K gaming. Like other RX 7900 XT cards, this GPU has a tri-fan cooling solution to handle the additional heat generated by the cores and other components. What we've also seen with other RX 7900 XTs is a lack of lighting and XFX followed suit with the design of this GPU. You won't find a single RGB LED on the shroud. This GPU has the same specifications as other RX 7900 XTX cards with an identical number of AI and RT cores, as well as stream processors. Clock speeds differ slightly and XFX configured the Speedster MERC310 RX 7900 XT Black to run at 1,810 MHz with the ability to boost up to 2,220 MHz for gaming and 2,560 MHz for heavier workloads. With the same 20 GB of GDDR6 VRAM to work with, it's easy to achieve a stable 4K experience with conservative in-game visual settings. Picking the correct AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT for your gaming system largely boils down to how much you're willing to spend on a graphics card. We'd typically recommend one spend as much as their budget allows bagging the best GPU available, but if you're tight on cash there are some more affordable 7900 XT cards worth considering. All of our recommendations in this guide will work well with the latest AMD and Intel processors. If you want the very best AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT, we'd recommend going with the Gigabyte Gaming OC Radeon RX 7900 XT. Gigabyte makes some excellent graphics cards and the RX 7900 XT Gaming OC is a superb GPU. It has plenty of RAM, good clock speeds, effective cooling, and decent official driver support, even on Linux.
